Name: Organism Classification
Description: An organism classification is a set of living things, (e.g., plants, animals, microorganisms), that has a classification rank, (e.g., Kingdom, Phylum, Class, Order, Family, Genus, Species). All classifications, from the lowest classification (sub-species, cultivars, breeds and varietals) up to the highest classification (Domain), are organism classifications. The organism classification type should not be used for an individual organism, such as household pets, animal performers, racehorses, even named plants.

Properties.Name: Earliest fossil record
Properties.Description: The geologic time period from which the earliest fossil record dates.

Properties.Name: Higher classification
Properties.Description: The organism classification at the next higher rank

Properties.Name: Latest fossil record
Properties.Description: The geologic time period from which the latest fossil record dates.

Properties.Name: Rank
Properties.Description: The taxon rank of this organism classification

Properties.Name: Synonym scientific name
Properties.Description: Enter any scientific (latin) name other than the main one
